result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Myrna C Wieckowicz was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the half price Ignition Interlock based upon representation by the Public Defender's Office.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants huber/work release and good time. Must report to jail immediately. The first 48 hours of jail is without huber/work release. 
Court grants 3 days credit to be applied towards conditional jail time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myrna C Wieckowicz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Myrna C Wieckowicz in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF25,15TR102 and 15TR103
Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 - 6th offense. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Defendant waives PSI. State waives PSI. Court accepts the waiver.
Court orders Count 2 and 15TR102 and 15TR103 are dismissed.

Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court.

Court relates and orders:

SW - 3 years probation
$600 fine plus costs.
1 year jail with work release/Huber and good time.  (3 days credit on conditional jail sentence) Must report to jail immediately. First 48 hours of jail without Huber/Work release.
36 month DL revocation
36 month IID. Court orders 1/2 price IID due to qualification for public defenders office.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

JAIL FAXED

Defendant Myrna C Wieckowicz in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JT set for 6/5/15. Jury instructions, proposed verdict forms, motions in limine and witness lists to filed and exchanged by May 29, 2015.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  

Must submit to daily PBTs at the Chetek Police Department at 6:00 PM including weekends and holidays. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

AMENDED 3/20/2015: MUST SUBMIT TO DAILY PBTS AT THE CHETEK POLICE DEPARTMENT AT 6:00 A.M. BEGINNING SATURDAY, MARCH 21, 2015. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Myrna C Wieckowicz in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel who appears by phone.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's bond modification. Court modifies bond to allow completion of daily PBT's at 6:00 a.m. at the Chetek Police Department commencing Saturday, March 21, 2015 at 6:00 a.m. All other conditions remain in full force and effect.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail Bond

Defense waives right to a preliminary hearing. The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.
Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for trial.
Information filed. Formal reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered to all counts and tracking citations.
Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
